tn.text: The phrase, "got up," means to "awaken."
A place in the land of Moab, west of the Jordan River where the Israelites were camped before their entry into the promised land, Canaan.
These are people holding a position of command or authority.
This is the nation of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

"2,000 cubits." The word "cubit" is a measurement equaling the distance from the elbow to the finger tips. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This refers to a special preparation of being religiously clean before Yahweh.
Yahweh will be doing miracles for all to see and experience.
This is referring to the levites picking up the ark for the purpose of carrying it from one location to another.
Yahweh tells Joshua what the priest are to do.

tn.ref: I will make you a great man in the eyes of all Israel
tn.text: Here "eyes" represents the people seeing and understanding. AT: "the people will see what I do and realize that I have made you a great man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: edge of the waters of the Jordan
tn.text: Joshua is to approach the bank or edge of the Jordan River.
Joshua tells Israel what Yahweh is about to do
Yahweh will force the other people living on the land to leave or be killed. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"cross over" means to go to the opposite bank of the river. AT: "will travel from this side to the opposite side" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Joshua continues to tell Israel of the miracle that Yahweh will do.
Just as Israel's fathers experience crossing the Red Sea, these people will experience crossing the Jordan river on dry land.
This refers to the bottom of their feet.
This word refers to the direction the Jordan River water is flowing toward Israel.
The water will stay in one spot or place. It will not flow around the priests.
The word "ark" here refers to the chest that contains the stone tablets. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This can refer to the surface of the water as well as the bank where the water flows to dry land. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: now the Jordan overflows all its banks throughout the time of the harvest
tn.text: This is background information and it emphasizes the scale of what Yahweh is doing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
The miraculous Jordan River crossing continues.
This refers to the Jordan River bed. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This phrase means to go to the opposite bank of the river. AT: "traveled from this side to the opposite side" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
